Container.Name: MariaDB-Official
Container.Overview:
Official MariaDB database container. It allows to set a database and username without using the console.
Root Password: This container creates a random root password on initial execution. Open Docker > MariaDB Icon > Logs > Scroll down to "GENERATED ROOT PASSWORD" to find it.
Creating database dumps docker exec MariaDB-Official sh -c 'exec mysqldump --all-databases -uroot -p"YOUR_ROOT_PASSWORD"' > /mnt/user/Backups/all-databases.sql
Restoring data from dump files docker exec -i MariaDB-Official sh -c 'exec mysql -uroot -p"YOUR_ROOT_PASSWORD"' < /mnt/user/Backups/all-databases.sql

Config.Name: Generate Random Password
Config.Description: Set to yes, to generate a random root password. The generated password will be printed to the logs (Docker > MariaDB Icon > Logs).

Config.Name: Database Name
Config.Description: This variable allows you to specify the name of a database to be created on image startup.

Config.Name: Data
Config.Description: Recommened: For better performance replace /mnt/user against /mnt/cache. Note: This requires appdata share caching set to Prefer or Only!

Config.Name: Root Password
Config.Description: Generate Random Password must be empty if you like to set your own Root Password!
